title: A sad day for Blueprint Magazine fans...
content:
...and MSLO employees, of course.

“Martha Stewart Axes Blueprint”  
 [http://mediabistro.com/fishbowlny/magazines/martha\_stewart\_axes\_blueprin...](http://web.archive.org/web/20071212184510/http:/mediabistro.com/fishbowlny/magazines/martha_stewart_axes_blueprint_72588.asp "http://mediabistro.com/fishbowlny/magazines/martha\_stewart\_axes\_blueprint\_72588.asp")

Even though it was kind of a typeface three-ring circus, I did quite enjoy this magazine...!

:-(

 [‹ Sans Complement for Dolly](http://web.archive.org/web/20071212184510/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39934 "Go to previous forum topic") [Nachofoto? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071212184510/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39943 "Go to next forum topic")
author: fiftyfootgirl

comments.content: It was indeed nicely done. And a trendsetter ( [Fling](http://web.archive.org/web/20071212184510/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/stewf/sets/72157594159206925/) has seen a surge in use since _Blueprint_ launched).

I did enjoy picking up the magazine. A bit dull at times and probably repitious of MS Living magazine, though.

David

I thought that magazine would last, like for ever - but I was actually thinking of this mag...

[http://www.dominomag.com/magazine/2007/04/you\_went\_nuts?slide=32](http://web.archive.org/web/20071212184510/http:/www.dominomag.com/magazine/2007/04/you_went_nuts?slide=32 "http://www.dominomag.com/magazine/2007/04/you\_went\_nuts?slide=32")
Why sad? business is business. Sometimes cold as ice, but sharp like razor.
